Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
CAN: The student can draw a simple shape that might represent a fish, although it may not be distinct or recognizable as a specific fish type.
The student may attempt to label the fish but might only include one or two incorrect or generic labels like 'fish' or 'animal'.
CANNOT: The student cannot accurately draw or label the water environment (e.g., might draw land or an indistinct scribble instead of water).
The student cannot draw or label other plants and animals in the habitat (e.g., might draw unrelated things like trees or birds).
The student cannot show or label the resources that fish need, such as water or food (e.g., might include unrelated items like a bowl or toy fish).
The student cannot illustrate or explain how the fish and other living things are part of a system (e.g., might show random objects without understanding of a habitat system).
